samples.context: Sieve elements are the conducting elements of the phloem. Sieve elements are of two types â€“ sieve cells and sieve tubes. Sieve cells are present in Pteridophytes and Gymnosperms whereas sieve tubes are present in Angiosperms.
samples.question: What are the types of sieve elements?

samples.context: Companion cells are thin walled elongated specialized Parenchyma cells. They are associated with sieve elements. They have a prominent nucleus and cytoplasm.
samples.question: What function do companion cells serve?

samples.context: They help the sieve tube in conduction of food materials in angiosperms. Sieve cells are present in Pteridophytes and Gymnosperms.
samples.question: In which plants are sieve cells found?

samples.context: Sieve tubes are present in Angiosperms. Companion cells are associated with sieve elements and help in conduction.
samples.question: How do companion cells support sieve tubes?

samples.context: Sieve elements are the conducting elements of the phloem. Companion cells are associated with sieve elements in angiosperms.
samples.question: What are sieve elements responsible for?
